text: Sah Mal (also known as Shah Mal) ( –1857) was a rebel at the time of the Indian Rebellion of 1857, based out of the village of Bijrol, Uttar Pradesh. He led the Jats of Baraut in rebellion against the East India Company. In June 1857, Sah Mal seized 500 head of cattle, and collected escaped convicts and other locals and formed a force. On 18 July, British forces came under attack as they approached the village of Baraut. A group of fighters led by Sah Mal took up positions in a nearby orchard, and came under pressed attack by a Rifles unit. The Jat formation broke, and were attacked on the flank by mounted troops. Hand-to-hand combat ensued, during which Sah Mal was killed. ==References== ==Further reading== Category:Indian independence activists Category:Revolutionaries of the Indian Rebellion of 1857 Category:1857 deaths Category:Guerrillas killed in action Category:People from Bagpat district
title: Sah Mal
